bibl.title: Letter from P.M. Stewart to Laura Armistead Carter, October 2, 1925

div1.p: Stewart sends his sympathy upon the death of Henry Carter.

div1.head: Letter from P.M. Stewart to Laura Armistead Carter, October 2, 1925
div1.opener:
OFFICE OF
MEDICAL OFFICER IN CHARGE
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
UNITED STATES
PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
London - Oct 2, 1925.
Dear Laura-
div1.p:
I have just found in the last number
of the Journal a notice of your Father's
death. We all knew from your last
letter that his condition was critical
but it was nevertheless a shock to us to
read the report in the Journal. It has
always seemed to me that death
cannot come to some of my friends-
I just take it for granted that they
will always live - on and on and on.
I feel this way about Dr Carter and, in
the greater sense, I know it is true.

You have my deepest sympathy in this
time of your sorrow.
